result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth C. Willer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth C. Willer

records.addlTxt:
Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
The Court Orders: It is hereby ordered and adjudged that as to counts 1 and 2 the Defendant is ordered to serve 120 days of jail time as a condition of probation.
Proposed Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Petition and Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction Probation Cases

10:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth C. Willer in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Kenneth C. Willer. There is an agreement. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to an Amended Count 1: Misd Battery 940.19(1) and Count 2: Disorderly Conduct. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
1 year Probation sentence withheld with conditions on each count concurrent.

Conditions of Probation:
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs.
court costs

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.

0 jail credit if revoked from Probation.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:22 AM case called. . Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth C. Willer in court without counsel. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 4-13-22 at 1:15 PM. Return to court: 5-2-22 at 9:30 AM.
